Package database

Class Database

  • java.lang.Object
    • database.Database
  • public class Database
extends java.lang.Object
    Class representing the database and managing connections to the database. It also retains caches of countries and "first level divisions" pulled from the database, because the requirements spec said we can assume these are only updated once per year, making it reasonable to cache them per usage session.
    Author:
    Joseph T. Lapp

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      class  Database.OpenConnection
      Managed open database connection, which wraps the JDBC database connection.

      • countryCache

        public CountryCache countryCache

      • conn

        private java.sql.Connection conn
        The active (or most recent) JDBC database connection, which is managed within the wrapper class OpenConnection. Never access this variable outside of OpenConnection, even within the Database class (where it's private).

    • Constructor Detail

      • Database

        public Database()
         throws DatabaseException
        Constructs an object representing the database and tests connecting with the database. It also caches countries and "first level divisions" from the database, because this data only changes once per year, according to the project requirements.
        Throws:
        DatabaseException - on failure to connect to the database

    • Method Detail

      • openConnection

        public Database.OpenConnection openConnection()
                                       throws DatabaseException
        Returns an open, managed database connection. Allows only one connection to be open at a time. Although this is not a requirement of either databases or applications, it did help with finding unintentional nesting of attempts to open connections, which were inefficient for being able to share a connection.
        Returns:
        An managed open database connection
        Throws:
        DatabaseException - on failure to open the connection
